newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada bans overnight junk-mail faxes.
newsitem.headline: Canada bans overnight junk-mail faxes.

text.p: The Canadian Radio-television and Telecommunications Commission (CRTC) on Thursday banned overnight junk faxes for the majority of Canadians.

"With the growing presence of fax machines in Canadian homes, there have been many consumer complaints about the misuse of fax advertising," CRTC Chairwoman Francoise Bertrand said in announcing the decision.
Unsolicited faxes will be permitted only from 9 a.m. to 9:30 p.m. Monday to Friday and 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. on weekends.

It applies to the areas served by British Columbia Telecom Inc and BCE Inc's Bell Canada -- essentially British Columbia, Ontario and Quebec. The two companies had proposed the ban to the CRTC, which granted its approval.
